content:
@Dave Hill @Siama
MITRE Team,

Ron - Do you still plan to test/move Care Coordinator App (SNF-updated) eLTSS resources and data to the eLTSS+PACIO SNF Server for Scene 3?
Dave - Do you still plan to test/move PAC Assessment App (SNF) PACIO resources and data to the eLTSS+PACIO SNF Server for Scene 3?
We are prepared to move both updated SNF eLTSS resources and data along with new SNF PACIO resources and data if needed.

Hi @Forrest White , yes, I was planning on using the same server as during our warm-up on Wednesday. However, I'm not sure I understand what you mean by "move resources and data". My application loads and stores exclusively to the SNF server. It does not copy from other servers or sources. Does that help? (cc: @smahoney10 @Dave Hill @Siama )

@Ronald Perrella , thank you for the response. So, at some point in scene 3 you will upload some updated eLTSS resources/data, and then DAve will upload some new PACIO SNF resources/data to the SNF Server. We will then collect the eLTSS and PACIO resources/data from the SNF server and push them to the data manager. Correct?

@Forrest White , I think @Dave Hill would be using the PAC assessment app (per the diagram) to store the SDC data to the SNF server. The SNF EHR will then send it to the Heath data manager. I don't know the triggering event for the last send. (cc: @Siama , @smahoney10 )
@Forrest White Hi Forrest, I am working on writing directly to the Data Manager. What is the address for your server?
@Dave Hill eLTS+PACIO SNF Server: https://fhirconnect.altarum.org/hapi-fhir-jpaserver-pacio-SNF/

@Ronald Perrella We identified that you are writing the updates to eLTSS care plan for Scene3 to the eLTSS-CC Server. Please try again and write to the SNF server: https://fhirconnect.altarum.org/hapi-fhir-jpaserver-pacio-SNF
